hints.content: Let's try each strategy one at a time to see if they work.

Add $56+4$ then add $11$.

>$\begin{align}\greenD{15}+\purpleC{56}&=\purpleC{56}+\greenD{15}\\
&=\purpleC{56}+(\greenD{4}+\greenD{11})\\
&= (\purpleC{56}+\greenD{4})+\greenD{11}\\
\end{align}$

>Yes, this strategy works.

Add $15+60$ then subtract $4$.

>$\begin{align}\greenD{15}+\purpleC{56}&=\greenD{15}+\purpleC{60}-\purpleC{4}\\
\end{align}$

>Yes, this strategy works.

**The following strategies can be used to add $15+56$.**

- Add $56+4$ then add $11$.

- Add $15+60$ then subtract $4$.

question.content:
**Select any strategy that can be used to add $15+56$.**
